reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I rented a small vacation condo at this hotel. It was a little funky, but fine with me. Room was nice and had all the basics.
reviews.title: small condo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The balcony had a nice view of the garden and it felt very tropical. Place was quiet and clean. It is a little old and worn and is showing its wear and tear. It is a simple place to sleep and store your stuff. I don't spend much time at my hotel when I travel so it suited me fine.
reviews.title: Great location; beautiful setting; HORRIBLE ROOMS!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not stay here UNLESS you view the room first. Rooms were nasty! Shower was so dirty I had to scrub it before we used it and then it was still just plain ole stained plastic! The sink in the kitchenette is the sink you brush your teeth/wash your face in/spit in= not cool! I am not a finicky sleeper- I can almost sleep anywhere BUT the bed was horrible- it made a horrible sound when you sat on it or rolled over. Nasty, musty smell when you opened the door. You also had to pay $5 parking/day because there are not enough parking places for all the renters= very frustrating!
reviews.title: Lovely grounds, great location, dirty run-down unit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Also, it is false advertising when they advertise on the sign in front "rooms for $69 / 2+ nights for $59. NOT TRUE! I asked about renting a room for $59 and the girl at the front desk said, "we only have a few of those rooms available and they are always booked." And so I asked
reviews.title: Utter Misrepresentation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: asked about the $69 rooms and I got the same answer! You'll end up paying more like $89/nite. I can't stand false advertising!
reviews.title: A Dump!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were recommended to the Kona Islander by a family friend who stays for a month at a time. Unfortunately, we did not get to experience the nice unit they stay in.
reviews.title: Watch out for Unit 153!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival our unit wasn't ready - so we went out for early happy hour. When we returned a couple hours later and handed the keys and entered the room it STILL wasn't ready! No beds made, dirty floors etc. This unit was a huge disappointment - 2 queen beds stuffed into a studio, no chairs to sit on, really dirty, old furniture from a timeshare long ago. The only redeeming feature was its location - a ground floor, corner unit with ocean view.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay, but check the room first !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Following our first night on very poor beds, we discovered the dried vomit on the patio railing. On the second day we noticed the blood stains and other gross stains on the bedspread. This unit was nasty. There is also no insulation between units so you hear everything. If you are fishing and getting up early we recommend an upstairs unit to avoid noise issues We moved out after the 3rd night and were lucky to get a room at the Hale Kona Kai for our remaining 4 nights.
reviews.title: Will plan to book again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Kona Islander only provides one roll of tp, 4 towels and one hotel-size bar of soap for the entire stay.
reviews.title: No bugs here now...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon leaving we notified the management about the issues with our room - no apologies were given or attempts to credit our stay were offered.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: I booked a vacation trip through travelocity to Hawaii. I stayed at the kona islander inn on ali'i drive.
reviews.title: BED BUGS IN MULTIPLE ROOMS!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: Upon arriving at the hotel i saw a mattress leaning up against the wall next to my room (exterior doors). I did not put two and two together that the bed was prob outside cus of bed bugs.
reviews.title: Just a place to sort of sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the room 2 nights. Woke up second night to SEE bed bug on pillow! I captured it and told the hotel. I also saw bed bugs in the mattress. ADULT bugs.
reviews.title: nice practical Kona rental

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They refunded my money and when I walked by the hotel a few days later I saw they had removed the bed BUT the couch was still there and I KK
reviews.title: Great bargain, but take care about which room you reserve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: KNOW they didn't treat adjacent rooms. I also believe that the bed I saw outside was from room next door that had bugs
reviews.title: OK, but needs some work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The front desk clerk was wonderful, very welcoming and sweet.
reviews.title: Memorable because I needed luminol before touching anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed a room with two beds. So, when we got to our room the first thing that crossed my mind was "who was murdered in here?" There was a questionable large reddish brown stain on the floor along with other stains. I wondered how they murdered the victim and how many of the shoe prints on the floor belonged to the killer or if there was a struggle and those were the victim and killers shoe prints. After I convinced myself that I was NOT a detective I noticed only one bed with a very funky looking comforter that looks like it belonged to someone from the 80's, it was limp, faded and dirty looking. I looked around for the second bed which was behind me, it was a twin bed attached to the wall (kind of like a day bed, but built in) it also had a nasty comforter.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh and the TV had no remote and the armoire it was in had a goofy door, soooo I had to crouch on the floor to change channels and hold the armoire door open. (I did not plant anything on the floor beside my shoe covered feet.)
reviews.title: A lot depends on the actual unit and the owner's upkeep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: I know, this is a long one...
reviews.title: Do not stay here ROACHES!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room smelled like funk. Moldy, cigarette, wet, dirty, Frito foot smell. It was nasty. I didn't even want to take off my shoes!
reviews.title: Find another spot!
